priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Non-host Organism Identifiers Parameter Long Name Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C179590

self.title: CDISC SDTM Non-host Organism Identifiers Parameter Long Name Terminology

definition: Parameters used to describe the levels of taxonomic and non-taxonomic nomenclature of a microorganism.
name: Non-host Organism Identifier Parameters
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Non-host Organism Identifiers Parameter Long Name Terminology

terms.definition: A taxonomic parameter for the specification of clade of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the genotype of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the geographic location where the organism was identified, collected or came from.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the group of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the isolate of the organism.
A taxonomic parameter for the specification of lineage of the organism.
The accession number for a gene within the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) GenBank database.
The taxonomy identifier for an organism within the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) Taxonomy database.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the pathotype of the organism, which is classified based on its resulting pathogenicity on a specified host.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the pseudotype viral backbone of the engineered virus.
A taxonomic parameter for the specification of species of the organism.

A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the spoligotype of a microorganism. A spoligotype is obtained from reading of the unique spacer sequences in a highly conserved region in the genetic material of the microorganism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the strain of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the subtype of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the type of the organism.
A non-taxonomic parameter that can specify the year when the organism was collected or isolated.
